thread.title: Sign of the Kiwi emerges intact from fire
thread.title_full: Sign of the Kiwi emerges intact from fire

title: Sign of the Kiwi emerges intact from fire
text:
Sign of the Kiwi emerges intact from fire Last updated 15:30, February 18 2017 ALDEN WILLIAMS/Stuff.co.nz 
A helicopter arrives at the Summit Road fire, above the Sign of the Kiwi, on Monday evening. 
The Sign of the Kiwi cafe in the Port Hills has not been damaged by the Christchurch fires. 
The popular hilltop cafe, which has been recently restored and repaired after the 2011 earthquakes, appears perfectly intact. 
Apart from the smoke-blackened sign advertising a triathlon event, there's little to suggest The Sign of the Kiwi has been anywhere near a fire. BEVAN READ 
The SIgn of the Kiwi cafe still stands on Dyers Pass Road in the Port Hills. 
The roadside on the way up from Governors Bay shows little sign of damage and the cafe appears normal, with cushions still propped in the window. 
Bellbirds are still singing in the trees. 
But just 50 metres down the valley, a strip of inky hillside shows where the fire licked through the scrub perilously close. Bevan Read 
The Sign of the Kiwi has escaped damage in the Port Hills Fire. 
The road remains closed.
